text: Today dragged on like wet cement. I finished my responsibilities, but everything felt heavy and muted. I wasn't sad exactly—just dim, like someone turned the saturation down on the world.
I didn't want to get out of bed, but I pushed myself through the day anyway. I guess I'm proud of that, even though I'm still tired to the bone.
Work was chaotic, deadlines everywhere, but somehow I thrived in it. My brain was humming, overstimulated maybe, but alive in a way I haven't felt in months.
I spent the evening watching the sunset in silence. The sky burned pink, orange, then blue. I felt present for once—not happy, not sad—just here.
Tomorrow scares me. Opportunity, risk, possibility—everything tangled. I'm excited, but the uncertainty feels sharp against my ribs.
